intro: Hieracium acrosciadium, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It features yellowish to brownish composite flowers and has hairy, rough-textured leaves. Hieracium acrosciadium is often found in open habitats and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
